messages.title: Fairer Tax pledge exceeded
messages.content: At the last election the Lib Dems pledged to cut tax bills for low and middle income families, reducing bills by £700 and taking millions of low earners out of the tax system altogether.

messages.title: If the Lib Dems hadn't joined the Coalition, the Tories
messages.content: Given an Inheritance Tax cut to millionaires rather than £800 Tax Cut to working families. Introduced 'Regional Pay' meaning local nurses and teachers would be paid less than in London. ... Scrapped housing benefit for young people

messages.title: Don't just take our word for it
messages.content: "Lib Dems block extra £5.6bn cuts to welfare as Tories ask for more" - The Times, March 2013 ... "Lib Dems block bid to scrap the Human Rights Act" - Daily Express, October 2011

messages.title: Pensions
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats support a 'triple lock' rule, guaranteeing the state pension will rise by at least 2.5%, ... Only the Liberal Democrats can be trusted to give pensioners a fairer income.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to increase the tax threshold to £12,500, saving hard working families a further £400.
Lib Dems have committed to giving the NHS £8bn extra, to safeguard its future.
Plan to ease the housing shortage by increasing house building to 300,000 new homes across the country each year, focused on brownfield sites and Coventry.
Support a sensible approach of welcoming talented workers and students, and believe the UK would benefit more inside the EU.

issues.brexitEurope: Russell Field says 'Coventry is hugely multi-cultural, and we are proud to be a welcoming city. Immigration is hugely positive...'
issues.environment: The Lib Dems already have...plans to invest in home insulation to drive your energy bills down.
issues.health: The Lib Dems have committed to giving the NHS £8bn extra.
issues.immigration: Russell Field said, 'Coventry is hugely multi-cultural, and we are proud to be a welcoming city. Immigration is hugely positive.'
issues.socialWelfare: Lib Dems block extra £5.6bn cuts to welfare as Tories ask for more"

housing.content: Lib Dems plan to ease the housing shortage by increasing house building to 300,000 new homes across the country each year.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born and raised in this area, attending Woodway Park School and Caludon Castle schools. I have worked for the City of Coventry for a local Building society...

politicalExperience.achievements: I have been a Councillor in Coventry, representing Upper Stoke for eight years. I take pride in helping local people.

images.caption: Russell Field holding a campaign leaflet
